title: 114_s3338
content: The Act titled "Small Business Employee Retirement Savings Act of 2016" increases the credit limitation for small employer pension plan startup costs. The amendment increases the credit limitation for small employer pension plan startup costs to $500 for the first credit year and the following 2 taxable years. This applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2015. SEC. 45S allows small employers to receive a credit for adopting auto-enrollment options for retirement savings. The retirement auto-enrollment credit for small employers is $500 for any taxable year in the credit period, which is a 3-taxable-year period starting when the employer implements an eligible automatic contribution arrangement in a qualified retirement plan. The first credit year can also be the start-up year. The credit period for small employers ends when the employer is no longer a small employer or after the last taxable year in the period. A small employer is defined as having 100 or fewer employees. The credit is part of the general business credit. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes a new paragraph for small employers to receive a retirement auto-enrollment credit. This credit is part of the general business credit. The amendment allows small employers to offer auto-enrollment retirement savings options. The effective date for these changes is after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, the 10 percent cap is removed after the first plan year from the automatic enrollment safe harbor. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows small employers to offer auto-enrollment retirement savings options by adjusting contribution percentages. The changes remove the 10 percent cap after the first plan year from the automatic enrollment safe harbor. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code changes the contribution percentage requirement for auto-enrollment retirement savings options for small employers. The amendment removes the 10 percent cap after the first plan year and requires a minimum contribution of at least 6 percent. The effective date for these amendments is for plan years beginning after the enactment of the Act.
